title: Riordan array
summary: A (proper) Riordan array is an infinite lower triangular matrix, D {\displaystyle D} , constructed out of two formal power series, d ( t ) {\displaystyle d(t)} of order 0 and h ( t ) {\displaystyle h(t)} of order 1, in such a way that d n , k = [ t n ] d ( t ) h ( t ) k {\displaystyle d_{n,k}=[t^{n}]d(t)h(t)^{k}} .
